publicationStmt.p: published electronically as part of the TLS project at https://hxwd.org What are the crimes that all regular people commit? A regular person does nothing wrong. What crimes should he commit? Step forward, Perfected. Oh, How can you be so dumb! Foolish as I am I have not even started to comprehend. Never in my life have I heard that someone has committed a crime who has done nothing wrong and not broken the law. If this is what you are saying you state what is commonly said. You do not realise that people in general commit, in fact, six big crimes that are unforgivable. They are put on trial in person or have their progeny involved. You, Perfected, have studied but are not aware of these obvious crimes. Although you have studied you are not enraged by [the people's] distraction?" "Foolish as I am I don't care. "You may not care, but we all know that when common people die they are afflicted by resentment. They truly come to their end from being without understanding. What the situation is they realise only the moment they die. Since the division between heaven and earth the people in general have been blind until someone has enlightened them. I would like to hear what it was. Well, To accumulate teachings without end but refuse to instruct others on how to dissolve such blindness and search for life is an unforgivable crime. The culprit is tried in person or has his progeny dragged in. This is so because he destructs what heaven has taught and heaven is resentful. To amass virtue without end but refuse to instruct others on how to pay attention to preserving virtue and nourishing one's disposition is an unforgivable crime. The culprit is tried in person or has his progeny dragged in. I am not enraged." This is so because he destroys the virtue that earth has nourished and earth is resentful. He is severely condemned. Another person may pile up goods, millions and millions but refuse to save people who are desperate and rescue those in need. To let others die from hunger and cold is and unforgivable crime. The culprit is tried in person or has his progeny dragged in. This is so because the products of the harmony [between Yin and Yang] are the means by which heaven and earth show humaneness and provide sufficient support for all so that people do not become desperate. But someone may interrupt this process by collecting [these products] so that they cannot be spread. This person is an enemy to the harmonious vapour (qi) of heaven and earth. He is tried in person or has his progeny dragged in. (當 for 會) One must not for long [retain] what one has been collecting but pass it on. When heaven brings people to life it lets them know how to love what is good and detest what is evil. Someone fortunate enough to have knowledge will know of the teachings that origin in heaven but may think them worthless and refuse to resolutely study how to save himself. He will perhaps live long in the body that heaven's dispensation and the ancestors have bestowed on him but will think lightly of himself and refrain from study. He will view death in a careless manner. When close to death he will turn resentful. [This is] an unforgivable crime. He is put on trial in person or has his progeny dragged in. He makes people live without understanding and be resented by heaven. Since this is so, [人for天 ] when people resolutely enact Dao there is constant good luck while there is misfortune and death when Dao is ignored. Although heaven is fond of human beings, wants them to be good and has made Dao appear in the human body someone may refuse to implement Dao with energy. We call him person without Dao. Without bias heaven lets people make Dao their own and live long. But to cut heaven's Dao off is to be resented be heaven. That someone knows from birth to be virtuous and good but refuses to properly learn how to practice virtue sees no worth in it, detests rearing things and does wrong by making light of his person is an unforgivable crime. He is put on trial in person or has his progeny dragged in. Since this is so earth objects to him. It likes people to nourish by virtue. Someone as just described does not care about things, does not like virtue and is not fond of the body that he has inherited from his ancestors. Earth condemns him. When heaven brings people to life it, fortunately, gives them enough personal energy so that they can dress and feed themselves. But someone may refuse to invest his energy and will instead starve and freeze. In neglect of the body [that he has received] from his ancestors he light-heartedly puts his energy to rest - energy by means of which he could get clothes and food. Instead to continues to talk of himself as someone who is so wretched as to be on the brink of starvation and freezing to death. On the other hand, he always looks up with respect to houses that have a lot of wealth and exists in reliance on them. This crime is unforgivable. He is put on trial in person or has his progeny dragged in. Since this is so of the goods that heaven and earth have produced in order to nourish human beings everyone must according to their ability take hold of. Someone who has obtained enough will not suffer from exhaustion. But if he puts his energy at rest instead of activating it he makes light of himself. Perhaps someone has desires that bring him into conflict with others. Everyone who takes what belongs to others by force is an enemy to the central harmony [that exists between heaven and earth]. It is obvious that this crime deserves death. These six crimes are despised and hated by heaven. They are unforgivable. You know, Perfected, don't you? Yes, we do. We would like to hear from the Celestial Master why these crimes are so serious? Oh, no! Why is it that from day to day you are more foolish? These crimes exterminate families. What reason could there be to discuss their seriousness? Foolish as we are, we are completely naive and do not understand the main point. If the Celestial Master would only point it out to us, again, and let us understand the main point. Once we thoroughly understand what it means we would not dare commit another offence. Well, Perfected, you have put this well. What I have said should be listened to. You, Perfected, must in person take care to record it. Yes, we will. All right. Now majestic heaven with its Dao brings everything to life. All the different things look up to heaven for their mandate. Now someone with Dao and of great intelligence (for the term rou see TPJ sections 103, 105, 107, 108 and 110: positive quality in someone in official employment, or someone employable.) may perhaps remain silent in his deep knowledge of Dao and let it appear in his belly while refusing to teach it to others. But to teach Dao is like giving people fire. Should few people come to fetch it no damage would be done to its source. Should more people come than can be counted there would also be no damage to its source . Now a person who is so fortunate as to be able to share something by teaching the people who live under heaven assists heaven in bringing things to life, assists earth in rearing what has taken shape and assists the sovereign in bringing about good adjustment. He also lets everyone hold onto Dao, search for life and hate death, encourages self-regulation [for zhi as aspect of meditation practice see TPJChao p. 12-13; cf. Yang TPJ 2016: 839] and assists the government. The people will not again break the law and cause awful misfortune. Since his attitude is good he assists heaven, earth and the sovereign in nourishing all twelve thousand things so that each enjoys a long life. Once the people hold on to a humane attitude they will not again think lightly of robbing and damaging the myriad things. Heaven will then for this reason be merry, earth will be quite pleased and the sovereign will in great joy be free from worries. Such a person would have achieved a lot of merit, or don't you think so? Now, if in this way one person instructs a hundred ignorant people and a hundred, doing likewise, instruct ten thousand, ten thousand will together educate a million. When a million become teachers the people who gain instruction will be without limit. There is so much good in this that it merges up above with heaven's wishes and matches down below more things than can be counted. Everywhere, the people enjoy life and do good deeds. The sovereign, freed from government tasks goes on spiritual excursions. Again, why would anyone hurt others by depriving them from instruction? Nowadays some are so fortunate as to have received instructions and warnings from former teachers and to fully embrace perfect teachings (zhi dao) but cut them off. They do not show them [to others] and let the people remain without a mandate they can rely on. [gui ming a buddh. term?] This makes them die violently and full of resentment. We speak of a disruption to the Dao of heaven. heaven is no longer able to bring to life and earth no longer able to nourish. (大 for 夫) A person of some standing is unable not to know of Dao. (The TPJ has fu ren only at the beginning of sentences where fu can always be understood as particle) When human beings in multiple ways forget Dao and act recklessly Small-minded people are without Dao, often think lightly of themselves and proceed in a contrarious manner. They act against heaven's patterns and the structures of earth. They rise up to become bandits and robbers, rob and injure others and break the king's laws. They cause the lord much trouble. They have such wide-ranging connections that they cannot be defeated. The lord thinks of them day and night. Entranched in his wretchedness he makes heaven and earth lose their alignment. Disasters, anomalies and irregularities do not end and make the sovereign maintain and pass on [the trespasses of former generations]. And yet, I have not been able to tell all. To interrupt heaven's Dao is a crime of such great contrariness that it cannot be reported in full. Therefore, I have just started with the quintessence that the crime is severe enough to deserve death? and explained it to you, Perfected. It is obvious, isn't it, However, when dying someone may still have too many misdeeds that are not atoned for and for this reason has his progeny dragged in. “ "How frightening!" "You would better pay attention to these matters, Perfected. However, since you know of at least one aspect that is frightening we may say that you have obtained long lasting good luck and will stay away from misfortune and harm. " "Yes, we would not dare move away from these instructions." "Well, you are already worthy and enlightened. Since you know heaven's mandate you are bound to live and avoid death, there is no doubt. " "Now that we have with great respect heard the mandate of heaven's teachings we would like to know the instructions on the virtue of earth." "Well, it is so that the great virtue of earth lies mainly in that it obeys heaven's Dao by well nourishing the myriad things. Of the many different sorts of things none does not receive bountiful virtue. Earth is someone who brings to fruition what is within it. Therefore, a person of great intelligence and virtue must act as does earth. Since he is so fortunate to have received merit and energy from former teachers, he is able to store good Dao and unlimited virtue. It is always the case that when someone with virtue teaches others it is like bringing them close to a great water and letting them drink from it. When few people come to learn virtue they do not damage its root. When more people come than can be counted they also do no damage to the root. 教勑for 教教 ( Yu TPJ 2001: 206) If they are instructed with great energy they will, all of them, know how to remain intelligent and hold onto virtue. Everyone will, looking after himself, rear his person. Those good at it support heaven up above in nourishing the things that grow and support earth down below in feeding things until they are ripe. They all combine their energy in solidarity free from any evil intention. Among them someone of great worth and bright insight who is easy to inform can transform himself and rise to become a lord's assistant. Someone of average worth can become a chief clerk or teacher. Someone who lacks understanding can still become a leader among the people. Among the people in general, nobody would not want to become virtuous and do good. To instruct like this is of benefit ror heaven up above and for earth down below. It is the root of a great transformation. It helps the sovereign to nourish the population and prevents them from oppositional and evil conduct, while the lord, free from worries, allows his sleeves to hang down. It is obvious that [someone who instructs] has great merit. Heaven and earth love him and he can move into office. Now someone may perhaps hold onto much virtue (則 meaning what??) (delete the comma after 閉) but pretend to be a fool and cut off the road to Dao and virtue. He does not assist heaven in nourishing what is about to come to life assist earth in nourishing what is about to ripen or assist the sovereign in keeping the people in harmony. (令for 今) In consequence, the descendents of a foolish person are dumb without any understanding. For them, white and black are indistinguishable. (至 for 互, Yu 2001: 207) They will not change until they die but remain small-minded people who cannot separate east from west,( Yang 844: dong is road to life, xi road to death; Yu 207, more plausibly: they achieve nothing) take no care of their person and think lightly of themselves. They follow each other in doing wrong so that mischievous devices are piled up. (Yu 2001: 207 understands guei 軌 as jiu究 “plan, device") People situated up above and down below cannot teach each other. Being stupid and distracted they refrain from holding interdictions in awe. Above they act against the patterns of heaven down below against the structures of earth. Their movements oppose the four seasons and give disorder to the five phases. For the lord they are a great worry and people of low standing are injured by their robberies. (delete comma) Some even destroy themselves. They treat father and mother with contempt and have therefore no progeny. However, I now explain to you, Perfected, the quintessence to let you see where it [all] starts so that everyone will with complete insight only put things as he sees them. The refusal to teach how to retain virtue we call cutting off earth's way of nourishing. This is the crime. It cannot be put into words. But on his death there are still crimes that are not atoned for so that his progeny is dragged in. You know Perfected, don't you?" “How very frightening!" "Since you understand that this is a cause for fear we may say that you are able to live on. You must only take care." "Yes, we will. With great respect we have received prohibitions in regard to Dao and virtue. We would like to hear about the conduct of a person who is humane." "Well, as is well known all the goods that heaven and earth have brought forth are already entrusted to human beings. So goods are without root. They are neither up above fixed to heaven nor down below to earth. Goods belong to the central harmony [between heaven and earth] which allows them to be moved about. They go and they come as if they were floating. The person responsible must make sure to rescue the desperate and relieve those in need. Now people amass gold, silver and precious objects. Houses of much wealth have more than billions of [measures] of grain that they have collected and allow to rot. If a worthy man knows how to distribute goods poor houses are full of joy. He deserves to be called humane. He assists earth in nourishing things and assists the sovereign in maintaining honest and respectful people. But a house that has billions can rescue ten thousand families. When such a house gives away what is old and takes in what is new in an attitude that does not consider harm or profit their virtue matches heaven and earth. They are heard of in far-away places. Moreover, this allows them to always get new things and discard what is rotten. Those worthies among them who are of high rank regularly present the [list of their] merits to the sovereign. Those of small rank have their name regularly raised for advancement in the district or village. Among the people those who are so very foolish as to not appreciate the mercy they have received are not more than two or three out of ten. How should this make the person who gives so very poor? (transl. Yang 2016: 847); BH How should it be possible to let another person be in great poverty? Once a person does good without end worthy men of high rank who are intelligent and well-informed will raise him He will be famous within the country and within the four seas, people who take him as a teacher will block the roads. Should an enlightened king or wise leader hear of him and gain his assistance in nourishing the population he would be quite pleased. He would therefore request his presence at court and set him up in the rank of the three excellencies. On this basis he would gain honours that for generations would remain in place. However, people of great humaneness are rare in the world. A person who pays proper attention to his ancestors while not putting a load on his sons and grandsons is someone whom heaven and earth love. The hundred spirits favour him (朋 for 明) and the sovereign treats him a friend. Neighbours point to him as to a parent, his merits are registered in heaven and on earth and do not go away. The emolument that is attached to his official position is never lowered. His name is known among the ten thousand people, invariably. So why would someone not be humane? He may at times come by a fertile piece of land , fully obtain the goods of the realms between heaven and earth and hoard billions of measures of corn, millions of precious objects and things in gold and silver. But he stores them securely and hides them away in a dark chamber so that they all rot. When he meets someone in desperate circumstances who comes to demand help he berates this person and gives nothing. What he gives he does not give up but certainly seeks to take back with interest. At times this is twice the amount, at other times it ends only with four to five times [of the original amount]. When you give to the rich and take from the poor you let them die of hunger and cold. This is to ignore principles and laugh at them instead. It is resented by heaven, condemned by earth seen as hostile by human beings and abhorred by the hundred spirits. This is so because these goods belong to heaven, earth and the realms between them who jointly let human beings feed on them. But this house that by accident laid hold of the place where these goods are gathered is like the rats in a granary that usually are the only ones to eat their fill although the millet in such a large granary is originally not meant to be only the possession of rats. (小 for 少) The treasures of the imperial house are not originally meant to belong to only one person. People who do not have enough must all take from it. Foolish people without understanding are of the opinion that they are always the only ones entitled to own something. (户 for 尸)They do not understand that from the goods that the ten thousand households have delivered everyone must obtain clothes and food. Keen on his possessions and capricious regarding [people's] anger or happiness someone may refuse to put energy into rescuing the desperate and relieving the needy. He brings ten thousand families to their end: In spring they are without seeds and in autumn without harvests. Stricken by resentment they shout to heaven. Heaven is touched and earth moved. Someone who does not assist the ruler in rescuing the desperate and relieving the needy is the most inhumane person between heaven and earth. When someone is approached [for a contribution] to the performance of a sacrifice but does not give anything the hundred spirits hate him and wish to let him be without descendants. In a district of village he is cursed and people wish he would die. When bandits hear of him they come with raised weapons to attack his premises. In the end, family members may suffer or even die but he stubbornly refuses to give anything away. Instead, he buries it deep in the ground to let no one else see it. Without any excuse he cuts off the goods of all under heaven. By diminishing above ground what could be of use he creates instead a "great block" (34th hexagram) underneath. Since heaven hates him a lot and earth massively objects to him he stands greatly condemned. The goods that belong to the realms between heaven and earth are intercepted and become less and less. So, to put this person on trial is not enough. Many people die of hunger and cold. He is a serious enemy of humankind. We all know that heaven only likes [people with] Dao, that earth only likes [people with] virtue and that the realms between heaven and earth like [people with] humaneness. Things in general should be situated under heaven and above earth and then go everywhere to provide for people in general who do not have enough. (skip semicolon) But when things are buried in the ground they in great sadness hate that they cannot show themselves. We all know that heaven as well as earth basically do not like that [people] wish to obtain goods. But what heaven likes is people who bring to life and earth likes people who nourish things. A small-minded person with no understanding blocks the path for the goods of the realms between heaven and earth so that people cannot make adequate provisions. Such a person annihilates what heaven has brought to life and robs what earth has nourished . By hiding these goods in the ground without being entitled to do so he makes the country poor and shrinks its resources so that in cannot guarantee the people's livelihood. He makes the virtuous ruler's government appear empty-handed. Now, to produce goods and merchandise from gold, silver and other precious metals (comma between zhi and yong) demands a lot of the people's labour power. (苦 for 若)Such labour is truly hand and strenuous and should be put to use for the country's sake. When someone with excuse discards goods (土 for 上) and moves them away into the soil the earth does not enjoy receiving them but sees them as a great illness and a great block. Now [this] foolish person is really inhumane. Once he has committed such a crime he must die, or what do you think? Amongst such people, there may even be someone who is so careless to not know what is enough. Full of resentment he may raise arguments and turn to confiscate the goods of low-ranking families with small means. In no way does he understand when to stop. But I can see that you are eager. I have just explained the essential point to let you know how it starts. The misdeeds that someone commits who is not humane are so many that they cannot all be outlined (雖 for 難) even if we do the best we can. You must think about it, Perfected, deeply. Therefore, someone whom the three vapours of heaven, earth and the central harmony between them detest will when he dies have crimes not atoned for that his progeny is bound to be dragged in. Perfected, you'd better understand, wouldn't you? Yes, indeed. How frightening. I do not wish to hear of it. Should you, Perfected, ignore these words heaven is bound to rob you of your life in order to let you come to the understanding that it objects to your continued existence. Commit yourself to paying attention to what is going on. Yes, we will. Now we have already with great respect received warnings on Dao, virtue and humaneness. We would like to hear and understand what it means to not enjoy the study of true Dao. You have put this well. We all know that when heaven brings a person to life he may when fortunate enough to be worthy and knowledgeable become studious and live long. The Dao that is heaven's it likes to share with human beings. Earth likes human beings to participate in its virtue. The central harmony [that is situated between heaven and earth likes to nourish human beings with its goods. Therefore, someone who has throughout life searched for true Dao naturally becomes perfected, and if this does not stop him his expectations are as if he were a spirit. Day after day he sings the praises of doing good and so he is naturally good. In full concentration he serves the cause of worthy men so that they jointly instruct him and never again send him away. Since he can keep his person intact he does not turn his back on his ancestors' dispensation. While everyone else dies young he alone is able to finish the years that haven has destined for him. Everyone has a bad name, and he alone is seen as a good person. He acts as a teacher for crowds and becomes known in distant regions. Within himself, he holds on to true Dao, virtue and humaneness. He assists heaven in bringing things to life, assists earth in nourishing things and assists the sovereign in educating the people. A teacher of highest rank can educate more people than can be counted. He fully enables ignorant people to retain Dao and do nothing wrong. and a teacher of low rank can educate more than a thousand people. This is of benefit to the sovereign. This is so because small-minded people know the prohibitions, do not act against them and no misdeeds remain hidden. The ruler is impressed and [such teachers] obtain an office. They do not turn their back on their ancestors and bring no shame to their progeny. Someone who perseveres in these studies what would he not achieve? Therefore, the wise and worthy men of old worried greatly about how to instruct people. They assisted heaven and earth in bringing things to life and letting them ripen. They insisted the sovereign in sorting out what was disorderly. Such a one, between heaven and earth is called a good person. At times there are foolish people who from birth prudently hold on to knowledge but refuse to properly study true Dao and instead like to engage in trivial activities so that they may betray people. As a child they betray father and mother. As an official they betray the ruler. As an inferior they betray their superior. This is called to betray heaven and is a crime that is unforgiveable. Or they may instead turn to vulgar activities that lead to struggles and will, left to themselves, commit crimes. Should they observe someone who is a Perfected they may in turn laugh at him and will, while laughing, explain that there is no purpose in learning. In consequence they remain in the dark, foolish and without knowledge, keen on victory but incapable of achieving it. They reproach heaven and earth for being without the right code and worthy and intelligent men for lacking understanding. When they do something they follow emotions Up above they act against the patterns of heaven, down below against the structures of earth. Their going and coming do not follow rules and on returning home they do not serve their parents. When such fools stick together they have bad children. When they are employed in business for the local head they treat their parents with contempt. Since they are unable to think for themselves they end up as bandits who cause harm and bring people to death. There is no end to it. It is exactly what heaven interdicts, what earth condemns, what makes the sovereign feel wretched, what the hundred spirits hate and what wears down father and mother. This is the great disaster that harms the people and cuts of the thread that runs from ancestors [to their progeny]. Now, if someone rejects the study of true Dao and acts like this, in your opinion, Perfected, doesn't he deserve death? Crimes not atoned for at his death will drag in his children and grand children. But they are to be called an evil person's descendent and the successor of a bandit. Shouldn't the evil [someone has done] drag in his progeny? But now I have only presented you with the main points. These evils cannot be reported in full even by doing the best we can. Perfected, you'd better understand, wouldn't you? You'd better be careful." "Yes, we will. We are quite frightened." "By understanding how to be frightened you have already done away with evil."
